verses.verse: (Proclamation Against the King of Tyre) The word of the LORD came to me again, saying,

“Son of man, say to the prince of Tyre, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because your heart is (Jer. 49:16; Ezek. 31:10) lifted up, And (Is. 14:14; 47:8; Ezek. 28:9; 2 Thess. 2:4) you say, ‘I am a god, I sit in the seat of gods, (Ezek. 27:3, 4) In the midst of the seas,’ (Is. 31:3; Ezek. 28:9) Yet you are a man, and not a god, Though you set your heart as the heart of a god
(Behold, (Ezek. 14:14; Dan. 1:20; 2:20-23, 28; 5:11, 12; Zech. 9:3) you are wiser than Daniel! There is no secret that can be hidden from you!
With your wisdom and your understanding You have gained (Ezek. 27:33; Zech. 9:1-3) riches for yourself, And gathered gold and silver into your treasuries;
(Ps. 62:10; Zech. 9:3) By your great wisdom in trade you have increased your riches, And your heart is lifted up because of your riches),”
‘Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Because you have set your heart as the heart of a god,

Behold, therefore, I will bring (Ezek. 26:7) strangers against you, (Ezek. 7:24; 21:31; 30:11; Hab. 1:6-8) The most terrible of the nations; And they shall draw their swords against the beauty of your wisdom, And defile your splendor.
They shall throw you down into the (Is. 14:15) Pit, And you shall die the death of the slain In the midst of the seas.
“Will you still (Ezek. 28:2) say before him who slays you, ‘I am a god’? But you shall be a man, and not a god, In the hand of him who slays you.
You shall die the death of (1 Sam. 17:26, 36; Ezek. 31:18; 32:19, 21, 25, 27) the uncircumcised By the hand of aliens; For I have spoken,” says the Lord GOD.’ ”
(Lamentation for the King of Tyre) Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

“Son of man, (Ezek. 27:2) take up a lamentation for the king of Tyre, and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: (Ezek. 27:3; 28:3) “You were the seal of perfection, Full of wisdom and perfect in beauty.

You were in (Gen. 2:8; Is. 51:3; Ezek. 31:8, 9; 36:35) Eden, the garden of God; Every precious stone was your covering: The sardius, topaz, and diamond, Beryl, onyx, and jasper, Sapphire, turquoise, and emerald with gold. The workmanship of (Ezek. 26:13) your timbrels and pipes Was prepared for you on the day you were created.

“You were the anointed (Ex. 25:20; Ezek. 28:16) cherub who covers; I established you; You were on (Is. 14:13; Ezek. 20:40) the holy mountain of God; You walked back and forth in the midst of fiery stones.
You were perfect in your ways from the day you were created, Till ((Is. 14:12)) iniquity was found in you.

“By the abundance of your trading You became filled with violence within, And you sinned; Therefore I cast you as a profane thing Out of the mountain of God; And I destroyed you, (Ezek. 28:14) O covering cherub, From the midst of the fiery stones.

“Your (Ezek. 28:2, 5) heart was lifted up because of your beauty; You corrupted your wisdom for the sake of your splendor; I cast you to the ground, I laid you before kings, That they might gaze at you.

“You defiled your sanctuaries By the multitude of your iniquities, By the iniquity of your trading; Therefore I brought fire from your midst; It devoured you, And I turned you to ashes upon the earth In the sight of all who saw you.
All who knew you among the peoples are astonished at you; (Ezek. 26:21) You have become a horror, And shall be no (Ezek. 27:36) more forever.” ’ ”
(Proclamation Against Sidon) Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
“Son of man, (Ezek. 6:2; 25:2; 29:2) set your face (Gen. 10:15, 19; Is. 23:2, 4, 12; Ezek. 27:8; 32:30) toward Sidon, and prophesy against her,

and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: (Ex. 14:4, 17; Ezek. 39:13) “Behold, I am against you, O Sidon; I will be glorified in your midst; And (Ps. 9:16) they shall know that I am the LORD, When I execute judgments in her and am (Ezek. 28:25) hallowed in her.
(Ezek. 38:22) For I will send pestilence upon her, And blood in her streets; The wounded shall be judged in her midst By the sword against her on every side; Then they shall know that I am the LORD.

“And there shall no longer be a pricking brier or (Num. 33:55; Josh. 23:13; Is. 55:13; Ezek. 2:6) a painful thorn for the house of Israel from among all who are around them, who (Ezek. 16:57; 25:6, 7) despise them. Then they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.”

(Israel’s Future Blessing) ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “When I have (Ps. 106:47; Is. 11:12, 13; Jer. 32:37; Ezek. 11:17; 20:41; 34:13; 37:21) gathered the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and am (Ezek. 28:22) hallowed in them in the sight of the Gentiles, then they will dwell in their own land which I gave to My servant Jacob.

And they will (Jer. 23:6; Ezek. 36:28) dwell safely there, (Is. 65:21; Jer. 32:15, 43, 44; Amos 9:13, 14) build houses, and (Jer. 31:5; Amos 9:14) plant vineyards; yes, they will dwell securely, when I execute judgments on all those around them who despise them. Then they shall know that I am the LORD their God.” ’ ”
